00023   struct RecList
00024   {
00025     virtual ~RecList() {}
00026 
00027     virtual void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id) = 0;
00028     virtual int getSize() = 0;
00029     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const = 0;
00030 
00031     static std::string toLower (const std::string& name)
00032     {
00033         std::string lowerCase;
00034 
00035         std::transform (name.begin(), name.end(), std::back_inserter (lowerCase),
00036             (int(*)(int)) std::tolower);
00037 
00038         return lowerCase;
00039     }
00040   };

00044   template <typename X>
00045   struct RecListT : RecList
00046   {
00047     virtual ~RecListT() {}
00048 
00049     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00050 
00051     MapType list;
00052 
00053     // Load one object of this type
00054     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00055     {
00056       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00057       list[id2].load(esm);
00058     }
00059 
00060     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00061     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00062     {
00063         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00064 
00065         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00066 
00067         if (iter == list.end())
00068             return NULL;
00069 
00070         return &iter->second;
00071     }
00072 
00073     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00074     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00075     {
00076         const X *object = search (id);
00077 
00078         if (!object)
00079             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00080 
00081         return object;
00082     }
00083 
00084     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00085 
00086     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00087     {
00088         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00089             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00090     }
00091   };

00196   /* Land textures are indexed by an integer number

00198   struct LTexList : RecList
00199   {
00200     virtual ~LTexList() {}
00201 
00202     // TODO: For multiple ESM/ESP files we need one list per file.
00203     std::vector<LandTexture> ltex;
00204     int count;
00205 
00206     LTexList() : count(0)
00207     {
00208       // More than enough to hold Morrowind.esm.
00209       ltex.reserve(128);
00210     }
00211 
00212     int getSize() { return count; }
00213 
00214     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00215 
00216     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00217     {
00218       LandTexture lt;
00219       lt.load(esm);
00220       lt.id = id;
00221 
00222       // Make sure we have room for the structure
00223       if(lt.index + 1 > (int)ltex.size())
00224         ltex.resize(lt.index+1);
00225 
00226       // Store it
00227       ltex[lt.index] = lt;
00228     }
00229   };

00231   /* Landscapes are indexed by the X,Y coordinates of the exterior
00232      cell they belong to.
00233    */
00234   struct LandList : RecList
00235   {
00236     virtual ~LandList() {}
00237 
00238     // Map containing all landscapes
00239     typedef std::map<int, Land*> LandsCol;
00240     typedef std::map<int, LandsCol> Lands;
00241     Lands lands;
00242 
00243     int count;
00244     LandList() : count(0) {}
00245     int getSize() { return count; }
00246 
00247     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00248 
00249     // Find land for the given coordinates. Return null if no data.
00250     const Land *search(int x, int y) const
00251     {
00252       Lands::const_iterator it = lands.find(x);
00253       if(it==lands.end())
00254         return NULL;
00255 
00256       LandsCol::const_iterator it2 = it->second.find(y);
00257       if(it2 == it->second.end())
00258         return NULL;
00259 
00260       return it2->second;
00261     }
00262 
00263     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00264     {
00265       count++;
00266 
00267       // Create the structure and load it. This actually skips the
00268       // landscape data and remembers the file position for later.
00269       Land *land = new Land;
00270       land->load(esm);
00271 
00272       // Store the structure
00273       lands[land->X][land->Y] = land;
00274     }
00275   };

00277     struct ciLessBoost : std::binary_function<std::string, std::string, bool>
00278 {
00279     bool operator() (const std::string & s1, const std::string & s2) const {
00280                                                //case insensitive version of is_less
00281         return lexicographical_compare(s1, s2, is_iless());
00282     }
00283 };

00286   // Cells aren't simply indexed by name. Exterior cells are treated
00287   // separately.
00288   // TODO: case handling (cell names are case-insensitive, but they are also showen to the
00289   // player, so we can't simply smash case.
00290   struct CellList : RecList
00291   {
00292     // Total cell count. Used for statistics.
00293     int count;
00294     CellList() : count(0) {}
00295     int getSize() { return count; }
00296 
00297     // List of interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00298     typedef std::map<std::string,ESM::Cell*, ciLessBoost> IntCells;
00299     IntCells intCells;
00300 
00301     // List of exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00302     typedef std::map<std::pair<int, int>, ESM::Cell*> ExtCells;
00303     ExtCells extCells;
00304 
00305     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00306     {
00307         for (IntCells::const_iterator iter (intCells.begin()); iter!=intCells.end(); ++iter)
00308             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00309     }
00310 
00311     virtual ~CellList()
00312     {
00313       for (IntCells::iterator it = intCells.begin(); it!=intCells.end(); ++it)
00314         delete it->second;
00315 
00316       for (ExtCells::iterator it = extCells.begin(); it!=extCells.end(); ++it)
00317           delete it->second;
00318     }
00319 
00320     const ESM::Cell* searchInt(const std::string &id) const
00321     {
00322       IntCells::const_iterator iter = intCells.find(id);
00323 
00324       if (iter!=intCells.end())
00325         return iter->second;
00326 
00327       return 0;
00328     }
00329 
00330     const ESM::Cell* findInt(const std::string &id) const
00331     {
00332       const ESM::Cell *cell = searchInt (id);
00333 
00334       if (!cell)
00335          throw std::runtime_error ("Interior cell not found - " + id);
00336 
00337       return cell;
00338     }
00339 
00340     const ESM::Cell *searchExt (int x, int y) const
00341     {
00342         ExtCells::const_iterator it = extCells.find (std::make_pair (x, y));
00343 
00344         if (it==extCells.end())
00345             return 0;
00346 
00347         return it->second;
00348     }
00349 
00350     const ESM::Cell *findExt (int x, int y) const
00351     {
00352         const ESM::Cell *cell = searchExt (x, y);
00353 
00354         if (!cell)
00355             throw std::runtime_error ("Exterior cell not found");
00356 
00357         return cell;
00358     }
00359     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByName (const std::string& id) const
00360     {
00361         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00362         {
00363             if (toLower (iter->second->name) == toLower (id))
00364                 return iter->second;
00365         }
00366 
00367         return 0;
00368     }
00369 
00370     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByRegion (const std::string& id) const
00371     {
00372         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00373 
00374         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00375             if (toLower (iter->second->region)==id)
00376                 return iter->second;
00377 
00378         return 0;
00379     }
00380 
00381     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00382     {
00383       count++;
00384 
00385       // All cells have a name record, even nameless exterior cells.
00386       ESM::Cell *cell = new ESM::Cell;
00387       cell->name = id;
00388 
00389       // The cell itself takes care of all the hairy details
00390       cell->load(esm);
00391 
00392       if(cell->data.flags & ESM::Cell::Interior)
00393         {
00394           // Store interior cell by name
00395           intCells[id] = cell;
00396         }
00397       else
00398         {
00399           // Store exterior cells by grid position
00400           extCells[std::make_pair (cell->data.gridX, cell->data.gridY)] = cell;
00401         }
00402     }
00403   };

00405   struct PathgridList : RecList
00406   {
00407       int count;
00408 
00409       // List of grids for interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00410       typedef std::map<std::string,ESM::Pathgrid*, ciLessBoost> IntGrids;
00411       IntGrids intGrids;
00412 
00413       // List of grids for exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00414       typedef std::map<std::pair<int, int>, ESM::Pathgrid*> ExtGrids;
00415       ExtGrids extGrids;
00416 
00417       PathgridList() : count(0) {}
00418 
00419       virtual ~PathgridList()
00420       {
00421           for (IntGrids::iterator it = intGrids.begin(); it!=intGrids.end(); ++it)
00422               delete it->second;
00423 
00424           for (ExtGrids::iterator it = extGrids.begin(); it!=extGrids.end(); ++it)
00425               delete it->second;
00426       }
00427 
00428       int getSize() { return count; }
00429 
00430       virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00431       {
00432           // do nothing
00433       }
00434 
00435       void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00436       {
00437           count++;
00438           ESM::Pathgrid *grid = new ESM::Pathgrid;
00439           grid->load(esm);
00440           if (grid->data.x == 0 && grid->data.y == 0)
00441           {
00442               intGrids[grid->cell] = grid;
00443           }
00444           else
00445           {
00446               extGrids[std::make_pair(grid->data.x, grid->data.y)] = grid;
00447           }
00448       }
00449 
00450       Pathgrid *find(int cellX, int cellY, std::string cellName) const
00451       {
00452           Pathgrid *result = search(cellX, cellY, cellName);
00453           if (!result)
00454           {
00455               throw std::runtime_error("no pathgrid found for cell " + cellName);
00456           }
00457           return result;
00458       }
00459 
00460       Pathgrid *search(int cellX, int cellY, std::string cellName) const
00461       {
00462           Pathgrid *result = NULL;
00463           if (cellX == 0 && cellY == 0) // possibly interior
00464           {
00465               IntGrids::const_iterator it = intGrids.find(cellName);
00466               if (it != intGrids.end())
00467                 result = it->second;
00468           }
00469           else
00470           {
00471               ExtGrids::const_iterator it = extGrids.find(std::make_pair(cellX, cellY));
00472               if (it != extGrids.end())
00473                 result = it->second;
00474           }
00475           return result;
00476       }
00477 
00478       Pathgrid *search(const ESM::Cell &cell) const
00479       {
00480           int cellX, cellY;
00481           if (cell.data.flags & ESM::Cell::Interior)
00482           {
00483               cellX = cellY = 0;
00484           }
00485           else
00486           {
00487               cellX = cell.data.gridX;
00488               cellY = cell.data.gridY;
00489           }
00490           return search(cellX, cellY, cell.name);
00491       }
00492   };

00494   template <typename X>
00495   struct ScriptListT : RecList
00496   {
00497     virtual ~ScriptListT() {}
00498 
00499     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00500 
00501     MapType list;
00502 
00503     // Load one object of this type
00504     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00505     {
00506       X ref;
00507       ref.load (esm);
00508 
00509       std::string realId = toLower (ref.data.name.toString());
00510 
00511       std::swap (list[realId], ref);
00512     }
00513 
00514     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00515     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00516     {
00517         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00518 
00519         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00520 
00521         if (iter == list.end())
00522             return NULL;
00523 
00524         return &iter->second;
00525     }
00526 
00527     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00528     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00529     {
00530         const X *object = search (id);
00531 
00532         if (!object)
00533             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00534 
00535         return object;
00536     }
00537 
00538     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00539 
00540     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00541     {
00542         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00543             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00544     }
00545   };

00547   template <typename X>
00548   struct IndexListT
00549   {
00550         virtual ~IndexListT() {}
00551 
00552         typedef std::map<int, X> MapType;
00553 
00554         MapType list;
00555 
00556         void load(ESMReader &esm)
00557         {
00558             X ref;
00559             ref.load (esm);
00560             int index = ref.index;
00561             list[index] = ref;
00562         }
00563 
00564         int getSize()
00565         {
00566             return list.size();
00567         }
00568 
00569         virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00570 
00571         // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00572         const X* search (int id) const
00573         {
00574             typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id);
00575 
00576             if (iter == list.end())
00577                 return NULL;
00578 
00579             return &iter->second;
00580         }
00581 
00582         // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00583         const X* find (int id) const
00584         {
00585             const X *object = search (id);
00586 
00587             if (!object)
00588             {
00589                 std::ostringstream error;
00590                 error << "object " << id << " not found";
00591                 throw std::runtime_error (error.str());
00592             }
00593 
00594             return object;
00595         }
00596   };
